question: 1. Morgan had Julia ______ the bedroom.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + have (in any tense) + object (usually a person) + base form of verb + . . . .

question: 2. He always has me _____ his work.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + have (any form of tense) + object (usually a person) + base form of verb + . . . .

question: 3. Mary will have me _______ her homework.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + have (any tense) + object (usually person) + base form of verb + . . . .

question: 4. John had his car ______ with only $3.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + have (any tense) + object (usually thing) + past participle form of verb + . . . .

question: 5. He always has his work ______.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + have (any tense) + object (usually thing) + past participle form of verb + . . . .

question: 6. She will have her homework _______.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + get (any tense) + object (usually person) + infinitive + . . . .

question: 7. She got Alex _______ the bedroom.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + get (any tense) + object (usually person) + infinitive + . . . .

question: 8. You always get me _____ your own work.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + help (any tense) + object (always person) + base form of verb/infinitive + . . .

question: 9. This machine will help you _____ faster.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + make (any tense) + object (always person) + base form of verb + . . .

question: 10. I will make you _____ for this insult.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + let (any tense) + object (always person) + base form of verb +. . .

question: 11. I will let you _____ if you complete the task first.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + made (any form of tense) + object (usually person) + base form of verb +. . .

question: 12. Alex made her _____ whole night.
explanation: Explanation:  Subject + help (any tense) + object (usually person) + base form of verb/Infinitive +. . .

question: 13. Robert helped me _____ the prison.
explanation: Explanation:  Any form of 'make' demands the next verb to be in BASE FORM.

question: 14. What have I told you to make you _____?
explanation: Explanation:  'Impress' is not a causative verb. It follows the 'right form of verbs' rules.

question: 15. My behaviors will not impress a lady _____ in love with me.

question: 16. Doctor advised him –
options: to stay at home, taking proper medication and avoiding junk food.
staying at home, to take proper medication and to avoid junk food.
to stay at home, to take proper medication and avoiding junk food.
